text:
My favourite part is the generated list of possible queries which match your selection. It is quite similar to Wrangler/Trifacta <http://vis.stanford.edu/wrangler/>

It pushes a lot of the difficulty of programming onto the computer, but at the same time it doesn't introduce any black box/ML/woo that will inevitably go wrong.

elements.text: My favourite part is the generated list of possible queries which match your selection. It is quite similar to Wrangler/Trifacta
It pushes a lot of the difficulty of programming onto the computer, but at the same time it doesn't introduce any black box/ML/woo that will inevitably go wrong.

text: Yes. More than that, I'm not sure you couldn't make a block-based editor work that way. If CTRL+drag allowed you to place a term outside another term instead of inside it, changing what qualifies as a place you can drop it, you could drop *4 on top of whatever you like. You could even have three modes, one for matching external only (the default now), one for matching internal only, and one for matching both. But again... who needs it? Anyone? I don't know.
